Posts.Title: 1st chemo

Posts.Content: Don't waste any energy worrying about chemo it really is not as bad as you think. I eas really freakinf ourt at the thought of the needle and was a nervous twitchy wreck but the chemo nurses are so good they will put you at ease. Just think that after Thursday you will have one less to do! Do remember to take your antisickness tables that you will be prescribed. I'msure all will go well on Thursday take care jazzx
Posts.Title: 1st chemo

Posts.Content: Don't feel the need to say sorry for anything you say on here. There are lots of people here who know exactly how you feel and are more than willing to help and to share their experiences with you. Take care and remember there is always some one here to hear what you say. Jazzx
Posts.Title: I am new to your Forum so sorry if i get this wrong.

Posts.Content: Hi folks, I have just had the 6th cycle of chemotherapy and have 2 more to go. Then I have to have radiotherapy. I know there is siupposed to be a period of time between the end of chemo and the start of the radiotherapy and I wonder if anyone can let me know the length of time between the two. I know there is no diffinitive answer but would like to have some kind of ballpark figure. One reason I need to know is to plan when for me is the best time to return to work. I am coming to the end of my full time sick pay entitlement and going onto half pay is going to be a very tight squeeze as you can all imagine. It would also be good to have some comments (please) from those who worked through radiotherapy. Thanks for your help Jazzx
Posts.Title: chemotherapy and radiotherapy

Posts.Content: I know what you mean by the steamroller effect, it's almost as if everything is taken out of your control. I elected not to have reconstruction straight away as I had read that radiation can effect what reconstruction you can have. I had the op a couple o f weeks agao and am getting used to just having one boob and i'm amazed at just how little it does bother me. I've also spent a lot of time recently reading all I can find, raiding the local library and investigating web sites. The more I have found out the less the fear becomes. Take care, and I hope all goes well for you, JazzcatXX
Posts.Title: Steamrollered - Whats the rush!

Posts.Content: Hi Noj,     I started on Tamoxifen last October and have found that I have had cramp in my calves. It tends to happen in the morning just before I get out of bed and am having a stretch! So now I don't strtech that leg as much! I find I am still having quite a few hot spells still. I had hoped they would have gone by now but they show no sign of reducing! Take care, Kathx
